intro: Byttneria boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian sandpaper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, sandpaper-like bark and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
